item.title: Town System
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

He’ll probably still get errors because that } is separating two voids. He is only calling upon one void, if he changes that, then he’ll be calling on two voids at the same time, which won’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Town System
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

Try adding something like

return = true;

Somewhere in there.

[quote=“killah246, post:4, topic:90423”]I’ve never seen that error …
Hmm try doing the } the other way round {[/quote]

That won’t work. } means it’s the end of the code, { means the code is continued. He’ll get a lot of errors if he does that.

Read full topic

item.title: Town System
item.dc:creator: @jungledude jungledude
item.description:
@jungledude wrote:

Well I’m trying to make a town system… So in certain areas it tells you what town you are in! This is what i have so far…

public boolean zones() { 
	if(chaos() && nonWild()) {
    	sendFrame126("@gre@Area : Chaos Lair (safe)", 6572);
	}
	if (zybertown() && nonWild()) {
	sendFrame126("@gre@Area : Zyber Town (safe)", 6572);
        } else {
	sendFrame126("@gre@Area : DANGER ZONE!", 6572);
}
}

But when i compile i get

client.java:24249: missing return statement
        }
        ^
1 error
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .

Please help me!

Read full topic
